questions.question:
A company operating in the AWS Cloud requires separate invoices for specific environments, such as development, testing, and production.
How can this be achieved?
questions.explanation: Using multiple AWS accounts allows each environment (development, testing, production) to receive a separate invoice and clearly isolates costs, security, and resources.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used in the application deployment process?
questions.explanation: AWS CodePipeline is a continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) service used to automate application build, test, and deployment processes.

questions.question: What can be used to reduce the cost of running Amazon EC2 instances? (Choose two.)

options.text: Spot Instances for stateless and flexible workloads
Memory optimized instances for high-compute workloads
On-Demand Instances for high-cost and sustained workloads
Spend limits set using AWS Budgets

questions.explanation: Spot Instances provide significant cost savings for flexible workloads, and Reserved Instances reduce costs for long-term, steady-state EC2 usage.

questions.question:
A company is launching an e-commerce site that will store and process credit card data. The company requires information about AWS compliance reports and AWS agreements.
Which AWS service provides on-demand access to these items?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports and agreements, including PCI, SOC, and ISO reports.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature allows the user to manage cross-region application traffic?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a DNS service that routes traffic across AWS Regions, enabling cross-region traffic management.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to track unauthorized API calls?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail records all API calls made in an AWS account and can be used to detect unauthorized or unexpected API activity.

questions.question:
A user needs to regularly audit and evaluate the setup of all AWS resources, identify non-compliant accounts, and be notified when a resource changes.
Which AWS service can be used to meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Config continuously tracks resource configurations, evaluates compliance, and notifies users when changes occur.

questions.question:
A user is planning to launch two additional Amazon EC2 instances to increase availability.
Which action should the user take?

options.text: Launch the instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region.
Launch the instances as EC2 Reserved Instances in the same AWS Region and the same Availability Zone.
Launch the instances in multiple AWS Regions, but in the same Availability Zone.
Launch the instances as EC2 Spot Instances in the same AWS Region, but in different Availability Zones.

questions.explanation: Launching EC2 instances across multiple Availability Zones increases availability by protecting against AZ-level failures.

questions.question:
A company must store critical business data in Amazon S3 with a backup to another AWS Region.
How can this be achieved?

options.text: Use an Amazon CloudFront Content Delivery Network (CDN) to cache data globally
Set up Amazon S3 cross-region replication to another AWS Region
Configure the AWS Backup service to back up to the data to another AWS Region
Take Amazon S3 bucket snapshots and copy that data to another AWS Region

questions.explanation: Amazon S3 Cross-Region Replication automatically copies objects to a bucket in another AWS Region, providing regional backup.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud service can send alerts to customers if custom spending thresholds are exceeded?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows customers to define custom cost thresholds and receive alerts when spending exceeds those limits.

questions.question: What is the recommended method to request penetration testing on AWS resources?

options.text: Fill out the Penetration Testing Request Form
Request a penetration test from your technical account manager

questions.explanation: AWS requires customers to submit the Penetration Testing Request Form to request authorization for penetration testing activities.

questions.question:
A user needs to automatically discover, classify, and protect sensitive data stored in Amazon S3.
Which AWS service can meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon Macie automatically discovers, classifies, and protects sensitive data stored in Amazon S3 using machine learning.

questions.question: Which components are required to build a successful site-to-site VPN connection on AWS? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: A site-to-site VPN requires a customer gateway on the on-premises side and a virtual private gateway on the AWS side.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing option is best suited for applications with short-term, spiky, or unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances are ideal for short-term or unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted and require immediate availability.

questions.question: Which AWS cloud architecture principle states that systems should reduce interdependencies?
questions.explanation: Loose coupling minimizes dependencies between system components, allowing them to evolve independently and improve resilience.

questions.question: What is the MOST effective resource for staying up to date on AWS security announcements?
questions.explanation: AWS Security Bulletins provide the most direct and up-to-date information about AWS security announcements and vulnerabilities.

questions.question: Which AWS service offers persistent storage for a file system?
questions.explanation: Amazon EBS provides persistent block storage that remains available even after an EC2 instance is stopped or restarted.

questions.question: Which of the following allows AWS users to manage cost allocations for billing?

options.text: Running all operations on a single AWS account

questions.explanation: Resource tagging allows costs to be categorized and allocated by department, project, or team for billing analysis.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows users to download security and compliance reports about the AWS infrastructure on demand?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact allows customers to download security and compliance reports about AWS infrastructure on demand.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS services are serverless? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda and Amazon DynamoDB are serverless services, meaning AWS manages the underlying infrastructure automatically.

questions.question: Which AWS managed services can be used to extend an on-premises data center to the AWS network? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS VPN and AWS Direct Connect extend on-premises networks into AWS, enabling hybrid cloud connectivity.

questions.question: Which requirement must be met for a member account to be unlinked from an AWS Organizations account?

options.text: The linked account must be actively compliant with AWS System and Organization Controls (SOC).
The payer and the linked account must both create AWS Support cases to request that the member account be unlinked from the organization.
The member account must meet the requirements of a standalone account.
The payer account must be used to remove the linked account from the organization.

questions.explanation: Before being removed from AWS Organizations, a member account must meet all requirements of a standalone AWS account.

questions.question: What AWS benefit refers to a customer's ability to deploy applications that scale up and down the meet variable demand?
questions.explanation: Scalability refers to an application's ability to scale resources up or down to meet variable demand.

questions.question:
During a compliance review, one of the auditors requires a copy of the AWS SOC 2 report.
Which service should be used to submit this request?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact is the correct service to obtain AWS compliance documents such as SOC reports during audits.

questions.question:
A company wants to set up a highly available workload in AWS with a disaster recovery plan that will allow the company to recover in case of a regional service interruption.
Which configuration will meet these requirements?

options.text: Run on two Availability Zones in one AWS Region, using the additional Availability Zones in the AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.
Run on two Availability Zones in one AWS Region, using another AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.
Run on two Availability Zones in one AWS Region, using a local AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.
Run across two AWS Regions, using a third AWS Region for the disaster recovery site.

questions.explanation: Using multiple Availability Zones for high availability and a separate AWS Region for disaster recovery protects against regional failures.

questions.question:
A company has a 500 TB image repository that needs to be transported to AWS for processing.
Which AWS service can import this data MOST cost-effectively?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is the most cost-effective solution for transferring very large datasets, such as hundreds of terabytes, into AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS service can run a managed PostgreSQL database that provides online transaction processing (OLTP)?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS provides a fully managed PostgreSQL database optimized for OLTP workloads.

questions.question: Which of the following assist in identifying costs by department? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Using resource tags and separate AWS accounts allows organizations to clearly identify and track costs by department.

questions.question:
A company wants to allow full access to an Amazon S3 bucket for a particular user.
Which element in the S3 bucket policy holds the user details that describe who needs access to the S3 bucket?
questions.explanation: The Principal element in an S3 bucket policy defines who is allowed or denied access to the bucket.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows for effective cost management of multiple AWS accounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations enables centralized cost management and consolidated billing across multiple AWS accounts.

questions.question:
A company is piloting a new customer-facing application on Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) for one month.
What pricing model is appropriate?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances are best for short-term workloads because they require no long-term commitment.

questions.question: Which AWS tools automatically forecast future AWS costs?

options.text: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator

questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer automatically forecasts future AWS spending based on historical usage patterns.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following is a responsibility of AWS?

options.text: Enabling server-side encryption for objects stored in S3
Patching the operating system on an Amazon EC2 instance

questions.explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for maintaining and patching the underlying hypervisor.

questions.question: A user is able to set up a master payer account to view consolidated billing reports through:
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows a master payer account to view and manage consolidated billing reports.

questions.question: Performing operations as code is a design principle that supports which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
questions.explanation: Performing operations as code is a core principle of the Operational Excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework.

questions.question: Which design principle is achieved by following the reliability pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
questions.explanation: Testing recovery procedures is a key reliability principle that ensures systems can recover from failures.

questions.question: What is a characteristic of Convertible Reserved Instances (RIs)?

options.text: Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs from a different instance family with an equal or higher value than the Convertible Reserved Instances that you are exchanging.
Users can exchange Convertible RIs for other Convertible RIs in different AWS Regions.
Users can sell and buy Convertible RIs on the AWS Marketplace.
Users can shorten the term of their Convertible RIs by merging them with other Convertible RIs.

questions.explanation: Convertible Reserved Instances can be exchanged for other Convertible RIs with equal or higher value, providing flexibility.

questions.question: The user is fully responsible for which action when running workloads on AWS?

options.text: Implementing controls to route application traffic

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for implementing application-level controls such as routing and traffic management.

questions.question:
An architecture design includes Amazon EC2, an Elastic Load Balancer, and Amazon RDS.
What is the BEST way to get a monthly cost estimation for this architecture?

options.text: Open an AWS Support case, provide the architecture proposal, and ask for a monthly cost estimation.
Collect the published prices of the AWS services and calculate the monthly estimate.
Use the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator to estimate the monthly cost.
Use the AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator to estimate the monthly cost.

questions.explanation: The AWS Simple Monthly Calculator is designed to estimate the monthly cost of AWS architectures.

questions.question: Which are benefits of using Amazon RDS over Amazon EC2 when running relational databases on AWS? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS automates backups and software patching, reducing operational overhead compared to managing databases on EC2.

questions.question: What does the Amazon S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class offer?

options.text: Payment flexibility by reserving storage capacity
Long-term retention of data by copying the data to an encrypted Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume
Automatic cost savings by moving objects between tiers based on access pattern changes
Secure, durable, and lowest cost storage for data archival

questions.explanation: S3 Intelligent-Tiering automatically moves objects between access tiers to reduce costs based on usage patterns.

questions.question:
A company has multiple data sources across the organization and wants to consolidate data into one data warehouse.
Which AWS service can be used to meet this requirement?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fully managed data warehouse service designed for large-scale data analytics.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to track resource changes and establish compliance?
questions.explanation: AWS Config tracks configuration changes and evaluates resources for compliance.

questions.question:
A user has underutilized on-premises resources.
Which AWS Cloud concept can BEST address this issue?
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows customers to match resource usage with demand, reducing waste from underutilized infrastructure.

questions.question:
A user has a stateful workload that will run on Amazon EC2 for the next 3 years.
What is the MOST cost-effective pricing model for this workload?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide the greatest cost savings for long-term, predictable workloads running on EC2.

questions.question:
A cloud practitioner needs an Amazon EC2 instance to launch and run for 7 hours without interruptions.
What is the most suitable and cost-effective option for this task?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances are the best choice for short-term workloads that must run without interruption.

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of using AWS Trusted Advisor? (Choose two.)

options.text: Detecting underutilized resources to save costs
Improving security by proactively monitoring the AWS environment
Implementing enforced tagging across AWS resources

questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor helps identify underutilized resources and improves security by monitoring best practices.

questions.question:
A developer has been hired by a large company and needs AWS credentials.
Which are security best practices that should be followed? (Choose two.)

options.text: Grant the developer access to only the AWS resources needed to perform the job.
Share the AWS account root user credentials with the developer.
Add the developer to the administrator's group in AWS IAM.
Configure a password policy that ensures the developer's password cannot be changed.
Ensure the account password policy requires a minimum length.

questions.explanation: Granting least-privilege access and enforcing strong password policies are core AWS security best practices.

questions.question: Which AWS storage service is designed to transfer petabytes of data in and out of the cloud?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is specifically designed to move petabytes of data into and out of AWS securely.

questions.question: Which service provides a user the ability to warehouse data in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is AWSâ€™s fully managed data warehousing service for analytical workloads.
